attributes.title: Where a Hershey's Bar Comes From

attributes.description: Polyglycerol Polyricinoleate is a chemical compound chocolate companies have recently started putting in their chocolate. It stops friction between the particles of cocoa, sugar, and milk, therefore making smoother chocolate. Previously chocolate makers used soy butter for this, but polyglycerol polyricinoleate is a less expensive alternative. Hershey probably gets this chemical from the largest manufacturer of it, Danisco, a Danish company that makes bioproducts.

attributes.description: There are many cacao farms in West Africa that exploit child slaves for their labor. Hershey refuses to disclose the information on where there cocoa comes from, which makes it difficult to track. Hershey has been accused many times of using cocoa suppliers in Ghana and the Ivory Coast that use child labor. The information on this case has not been open to the public.
